Detailed Description

template<class ObjectType, class EvaluatorType>
class stDBMTree< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >

This class defines all behavior of the DBMTree. Probably most of the atributes will be stored in the header page of the used stPageManager (stDiskPageManager or stMemoryPageManager).

First implementation is based on original code by Agma Traina, Bernard Seeger and Caetano Traina

Main modifications from original code are intent to turn it an object oriented compliant code.

Author:
Marcos Rodrigues Vieira (mrvieira@icmc.usp.br)
Todo:
More documentation.

Finish the implementation.

Version:
1.0

Definition at line 1208 of file stDBMTree.h.

Member Enumeration Documentation

template<class ObjectType, class EvaluatorType>
enum stDBMTree::tChooseMethod
 

These constants are used to define the choose sub tree method.

Enumeration values:
cmMINDIST  Choose the nearest subtree to the new object without increments the radius of the subtree.
cmMINDISTWITHCOVER  Choose the nearest object to the new object. It is possible to create a node to store the new object and increase the cover area.
cmMINDISTWITHOUTCOVER  Choose the nearest subtree that covers the new object. It is possible to increments the radius of the subtree but does not generate cover area.

Definition at line 1117 of file stDBMTree.h.

template<class ObjectType, class EvaluatorType>
enum stDBMTree::tSplitMethod
 

These constants are used to define the split method.

Todo:
Update documentation of each constant.
Enumeration values:
smMIN_MAX  Choose two representatives that generates the minimum radius from the greater.
smMIN_SUM  Choose two representatives that generates the minimum sum radius.
smMIN_FREE  Choose two representatives that generates the minimum number of free objets.
smMIN_COVER  Choose two representatives that generates the minimum cover region.
smMAX_DISTANCE  Choose two representatives that generates the maximum radius.
smMST_SLIM  This is the Minimum Spanning Tree of Slim-tree.
smMST_DB  This is the Minimum Spanning Tree with returnCollection.
smN_SPLIT

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

template<class ObjectType, class EvaluatorType>
stDBMTree< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >::stDBMTree (  stPageManager *  pageman  ) 
 

Creates a new metric tree using a given page manager. This instance will not claim the ownership of the given page manager. It means that the application must dispose the page manager when it is no loger necessary.

Parameters:
pageman The bage manager to be used by this metric tree.

bool stDBMTree< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >::IsRemoveFarthest (   )  [inline]
 

This method returns if this tree remove the farthest object when there is an object with greater distance than the new object and no space in a node to add the new object.

Returns:
True if this method can remove object to insert new ones or false otherwise.

Definition at line 1556 of file stDBMTree.h.

template<class ObjectType, class EvaluatorType>
tResult* stDBMTree< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >::NearestQuery (  ObjectType *  sample,
stCount  k,
bool  tie = false
) 
 

This method will perform a K-Nearest Neighbor query using a global priority queue based on chained list to "enhance" its performance. We believe that the use of a priority queue during the search in the leaf nodes will force the radius to converge faster than the normal nearest query.

This implementation may replace the original implementation if it proves to be better.

Parameters:
sample The sample object.
k The number of neighbors.
tie The tie list. Default false.
Returns:
The result or NULL if this method is not implemented.
Warning:
The instance of tResult returned must be destroied by user.
See also:
void NearestQuery

template<class ObjectType, class EvaluatorType>
tResult* stDBMTree< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >::NearestQueryPriorityQueue (  ObjectType *  sample,
stCount  k,
bool  tie = false
) 
 

This method will perform a K-Nearest Neighbor query using a global priority queue based on chained list to "enhance" its performance. We believe that the use of a priority queue during the search in the leaf nodes will force the radius to converge faster than the normal nearest query.

This implementation may replace the original implementation if it proves to be better.

Parameters:
sample The sample object.
k The number of neighbors.
tie The tie list. Default false.
Returns:
The result or NULL if this method is not implemented.
Warning:
The instance of tResult returned must be destroied by user.
See also:
void NearestQuery

Optimizes the structure of this tree by executing the Slim-Down algorithm.

Reimplemented from stMetricAccessMethod< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >.

template<class ObjectType, class EvaluatorType>
tResult* stDBMTree< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >::PointQuery (  ObjectType *  sample  ) 
 

This method will return the object in the tree that has the distance 0 to the query object. In other words, the query object itself.

If there are more elements that has distance 0 to the query object, this method will return the first found.

The object pointed by sample will not be destroyed by this method.

Parameters:
sample The sample object.
Returns:
The result or NULL if this method is not implemented.
Warning:
This method return only one object that has distance 0 to the query object.

The instance of tResult returned must be destroied by user.

template<class ObjectType, class EvaluatorType>
tResult* stDBMTree< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >::RangeQuery (  ObjectType *  sample,
stDistance  range
) 
 

This method will perform a range query. The result will be a set of pairs object/distance.

Parameters:
sample The sample object.
range The range of the results.
Returns:
The result or NULL if this method is not implemented.
Warning:
The instance of tResult returned must be destroied by user.
See also:
void RangeQuery()

template<class ObjectType, class EvaluatorType>
bool stDBMTree< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >::ReadUserData (  stByte *  userData,
stSize  size
)  [inline]
 

Reads an additional user data.

This feature allows users to write additional information in to the free area of the header page. The available space will deppends on the size of the header page (see the page manager documentation for more details).

Parameters:
userData A pointer to the user data.
size The size of the user data.
Returns:
True for success or false if the user data doesn't fit in this area.
See also:
GetUserDataSize()

WriteUserData()

Bug:
This feature is not implemented yet.
